Title:
Taxonomic reassessment, epitypification and systematic
position of Cantharellus yunnanensis W.F. Chiu (Basidiomycota,
Cantharellaceae) based on morphological and molecular data
Keywords:
Chanterelles  Phylogeny  Southwestern China  taxonomic
revision
Abstract:
Chanterelloid fungi with the broadest market in Yunnan are
always incorrectly recognized as Cantharellus cibarius because of
similarity in macromorphology. Actually, chanterelles as commodities in
Yunnan are consisted of species complex and they mainly belong to
another species C. yunnanensis based on systematic taxonomic study.
After restudy on morphological features on holotype of C. yunnanensis
characterized by lots of small basidiospores, we found the fact small
basidiospores were produced from young basidiomata. The size of mature
basidiospores is normal and similar to the species C. cibarius.
Combining characteristic observation and phylogenic analysis of nucLSU
and transcription elongation factor 1-alpha gene (tef-1), we make 1):
amendments to original descriptions of C. yunnanensis; 2): clarification
that species traditionally called “C. cibarius” widely distributes in
southwestern China belongs to C. yunnanensis; 3): confirmation the
existence of the species C. cibarius only in northeastern China; and 4):
suggestion the name Cantharellus yunnanensis W.F. Chiu should be
reserved.
